oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Ladies Rest Room: correspondence 3
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Wallace, Terry
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: 105 1st Ave. N., Lewisburg, Marshall County, TN
Terry Wallace, Marshall County Executive, thanks Carroll Van West for his efforts in nominating the Ladies Rest Room in Marshall County for the National and State Registers of Historic Places.

Built in 1924, the Ladies Rest Room is a one-story Colonial Revival-styled building. It is a rare physical remnant of the progressive agricultural reform movement of the early twentieth century, particularly the interest of reformers in encouraging the development of a consumer ethic among rural women and enhancing the reliance of rural women on commercial services available in local county seats.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Historic buildings -- Tennessee; National Register of Historic Places
Women's rest rooms
